pm kisan.description: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi Yojana
pm kisan.benefits: ₹6000 per year in 3 installments of ₹2000 each
pm kisan.eligibility: All small and marginal farmers with land up to 2 hectares
pm kisan.application_process: Apply online at pmkisan.gov.in or through CSC center
pm kisan.excluded: Income tax payers, government employees, pensioners not eligible
pm kisan.status_check: Check beneficiary status on pmkisan.gov.in with Aadhaar number
pm kisan.correction: Name or bank details correction available online

ayushman bharat.description: Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (PMJAY) - World's largest health insurance scheme
ayushman bharat.coverage: ₹5 lakh per family per year on floater basis
ayushman bharat.beneficiaries: Over 10 crore poor and vulnerable families (approx 50 crore individuals)
ayushman bharat.eligible_families: Socio-Economic Caste Census (SECC) 2011 database based families
ayushman bharat.covered_treatments: 1394 medical packages including 167 surgeries and 622 procedures
ayushman bharat.pre_existing: Coverage from day one, no waiting period for pre-existing diseases
ayushman bharat.card_use: Use PMJAY card for paperless admission
ayushman bharat.application: Check eligibility at pmjay.gov.in or visit nearest empaneled hospital
ayushman bharat.not_covered: OPD, outpatient drugs, dental treatments (except accidental)

ration card.description: Official document for subsidized food grains under National Food Security Act
ration card.quantity: 5 kg per person per month (for PHH), 35 kg per family (for AAY)
ration card.other_benefits: Used as identity proof, address proof, linked to other schemes
ration card.apply_online: Through state food and civil supplies department website
ration card.new_ration_card: Apply at nearest Fair Price Shop or Tehsil office
ration card.correction: Name/address correction at ePDS portal or local food office
ration card.ration_balance: Check balance by sending SMS, calling 1967, or state portal
ration card.one_nation_one_ration: Get ration from any state using same card
ration card.digitization: ePoS machines at ration shops for transparent distribution

kisan helpline.ivrs: Interactive Voice Response System for quick information
kisan helpline.sms_service: Get information via SMS by registering mobile number
kisan helpline.whatsapp_help: Many states have agriculture WhatsApp helplines
kisan helpline.kisan_call_center: Operated by Ministry of Agriculture, Government of India

soil health.definition: Capacity of soil to function as a living ecosystem for plant growth
soil health.soil_testing: Test soil every 2-3 years at government lab (nominal fee ₹50-100)
soil health.soil_health_card: Get personalized fertilizer recommendations based on soil test
soil health.organic_carbon: Should be minimum 0.5% for good soil health
soil health.micro_nutrients: Zinc, Iron, Copper, Manganese, Boron essential for plant growth

dengue symptoms.critical_phase: Days 3-7 of illness - watch for warning signs
diagnosis: Complete blood count for platelet monitoring
dengue symptoms.platelet_count: Normal: 1.5-4.5 lakh, Transfusion needed if below 10,000-20,000
dengue symptoms.danger_signs: Platelet drop, plasma leakage, organ failure
dengue symptoms.recovery: Usually 2-7 days, fatigue may persist for weeks

malaria symptoms.causative_agent: Plasmodium parasite (P. falciparum, P. vivax, P. malariae, P. ovale)
malaria symptoms.malaria_paroxysm: Cold stage (shivering) → Hot stage (high fever) → Sweating stage
malaria symptoms.falciparum_malaria: More severe, can cause cerebral malaria, organ failure
malaria symptoms.vivax_malaria: Can relapse after months/years due to liver stage
malaria symptoms.treatment: Artemisinin-based combination therapy (ACT) as per national guidelines
malaria symptoms.complications: Cerebral malaria, severe anemia, kidney failure, death
malaria symptoms.free_treatment: Available at all government health facilities under NVBDCP

covid symptoms.emergency_warning: Immediate hospitalization required if severe symptoms appear
covid symptoms.variants_symptoms: Delta, Omicron may have slightly different presentation (more cold-like for Omicron)
covid symptoms.long_covid: Symptoms persisting for weeks/months after infection
covid symptoms.oxygen_level: Seek help if SpO2 drops below 94%
covid symptoms.vaccination: Available free at government centers - Covaxin, Covishield
covid symptoms.prevention: Mask, hand hygiene, social distancing, vaccination

crop rotation.definition: Growing different types of crops in same area in sequenced seasons
basic_principles: Alternate deep rooted and shallow rooted crops
crop rotation.legume_importance: Legumes fix nitrogen in soil, benefit following cereal crops
crop rotation.cover_crops: Grow crops like sunhemp, dhaincha to protect and enrich soil
crop rotation.rotation_by_family: Don't follow potato with tomato (both Solanaceae family)
crop rotation.green_manuring: Incorporate crop residues/legumes into soil before planting main crop
crop rotation.traditional_indian: Three crop rotation common in India: Kharif → Rabi → Zaid

drip irrigation.definition: Water application method where water drips slowly to plant roots
drip irrigation.water_saving: 30-70% water saving compared to flood irrigation
drip irrigation.subsidy: Up to 80-90% subsidy for small and marginal farmers under PMKSY
drip irrigation.fertigation: Apply fertilizers through drip system for efficiency
drip irrigation.maintenance: Regular filter cleaning, flush lines periodically, check for leaks
drip irrigation.micro_irrigation_fund: NABARD provides additional funding for micro-irrigation

wheat farming.climate: Cool growing season, warm ripening period, 10-25°C ideal
wheat farming.land_preparation: 2-3 ploughings followed by planking, level field
wheat farming.sowing_method: Drilling in rows at 20-22.5 cm spacing, depth 4-5 cm
wheat farming.irrigation: 4-6 irrigations at critical stages: CRI, tillering, jointing, flowering, grain filling
wheat farming.fertilizer: 120:60:40 kg NPK per hectare (adjust based on soil test)
wheat farming.weed_control: Pre-emergence herbicide within 3 days of sowing, one hand weeding
wheat farming.harvesting: When grains become hard and moisture below 25%
wheat farming.threshing: Separate grain from chaff using machine or traditional method
wheat farming.storage: Dried to 12% moisture, stored in clean, dry bins
wheat farming.government_support: MSP announced annually, procurement by FCI

rice farming.climate: Hot and humid, 20-35°C, high rainfall (100-200 cm)
rice farming.soil: Clay loam with good water retention, pH 5.5-7.0
rice farming.nursery: Prepare nursery 25-30 days before transplanting, 1/10th of main field area
rice farming.seed_treatment: Treat with streptocycline for bacterial leaf blight
rice farming.transplanting: 20-25 days old seedlings, 2-3 per hill, spacing 20x15 cm
rice farming.water_management: Maintain 2-5 cm standing water during vegetative phase, drain before harvest
rice farming.fertilizer: 120:60:40 kg NPK per hectare, split application
rice farming.weed_control: Pre-emergence herbicide + one hand weeding at 25-30 DAT
rice farming.major_pests: Stem borer, Brown plant hopper, Leaf folder
rice farming.major_diseases: Blast, Bacterial leaf blight, Sheath rot, Tungro virus
rice farming.harvesting: When grains turn golden yellow and moisture 20-25%
rice farming.paddy_procurement: Government purchases at MSP through FCI/State agencies
rice farming.byproducts: Rice husk for fuel, rice bran for oil, straw for animal feed

fertilizer use.definition: Substances added to soil to supply nutrients for plant growth
types: Organic fertilizers: Compost, manure, vermicompost, green manure
Inorganic fertilizers: Urea, DAP, MOP, SSP, Complex fertilizers
primary_nutrients: Potassium (K): Disease resistance, quality, water regulation
fertilizer use.micro_nutrients: Zinc, Iron, Copper, Manganese, Boron, Molybdenum
fertilizer use.fertilizer_calculation: Based on soil test results and crop requirement
fertilizer use.urea: 46% Nitrogen, apply in splits, not surface broadcast
fertilizer use.dap: 18:46:0 NPK, phosphorus rich, apply at sowing
fertilizer use.mop: 60% Potash, apply as basal or top dressing
fertilizer use.balanced_fertilization: Avoid excessive use of any single nutrient
fertilizer use.toxicities: Excess fertilizer burns roots, pollutes water
fertilizer use.government_schemes: Neem-coated urea mandatory, fertilizer subsidy through DBT
fertilizer use.fertilizer_availability: Check at cooperative societies, authorized dealers

organic farming.definition: Farming without synthetic chemicals, using natural inputs and ecological principles
key_practices: Use of organic manure (FYM, compost, vermicompost)
certification_process: Apply to APEDA or recognized certification body
government_schemes: Capital investment subsidy for organic farming
organic farming.organic_india: Sikkim 100% organic state, many states promoting organic clusters

weather helpline.service_provider: India Meteorological Department (IMD) in collaboration with agriculture departments
weather helpline.sms_service: Register for weather alerts on mobile
weather helpline.agromet_advisory: Jointly issued by IMD and agriculture universities
weather helpline.farmers_benefit: Plan farming operations based on weather forecast

crop insurance.objective: Provide insurance coverage and financial support to farmers in case of crop failure
covered_risks: Storm, hailstorm, cyclone, typhoon, tempest, hurricane, tornado
crop insurance.balance_premium: Balance premium shared equally by Central and State Government
crop insurance.sum_insured: Up to value of threshold yield (scale of finance)
crop insurance.claim_calculation: Based on yield shortfall compared to threshold yield
crop insurance.enrollment: Through banks, CSC, insurance company agents before notified cut-off dates
crop insurance.cutoff_dates: Kharif: July 31, Rabi: December 31 (varies by state)
crop insurance.technology_use: YES-TECH for yield estimation, satellite imagery for assessment
crop insurance.restructured_scheme: PMFBY made voluntary for farmers from 2020, optional for states

jan dhan yojana.objective: Ensure access to financial services for all households
key_features: Life insurance cover of ₹30,000 (for accounts opened before specific date)
Overdraft facility up to ₹10,000 after satisfactory operation
jan dhan yojana.eligibility: Any Indian citizen (one account per adult)
jan dhan yojana.where_to_open: Any public/private sector bank, rural bank, cooperative bank
jan dhan yojana.insurance_enhancement: New accounts get ₹2 lakh accident insurance (from 2018)
jan dhan yojana.overdraft: Available after 6 months of satisfactory operation
jan dhan yojana.mobile_app: Connect with bank through respective bank's mobile app
jan dhan yojana.current_status: Over 45 crore accounts opened, deposits over ₹1.5 lakh crore
jan dhan yojana.beneficiaries: Women accounts priority, 55% accounts of women
jan dhan yojana.dbt_linkage: Subsidies directly credited to Jan Dhan accounts
jan dhan yojana.financial_inclusion: Part of government's financial inclusion mission

digital payments.definition: Electronic transactions for payments without physical cash
upi_benefits: Virtual payment address (VPA) - no need to share bank details
how_to_start: Link bank account to UPI app
Add beneficiaries or scan QR code
government_initiatives: Lucky Grahak Yojana (for promoting digital payments)
Discount on digital payments (fuel, insurance, railway tickets)
digital payments.limits: UPI: ₹1 lakh per transaction (₹2 lakh for some banks)
digital payments.qr_code: BharatQR, UPI QR - scan and pay

features: Send money to bank account using UPI ID, account number+IFSC, Aadhaar number, QR code
Multiple bank accounts in one app
how_to_use: Download BHIM app from Play Store/App Store
Register with mobile number (linked to bank)
Create UPI PIN for each bank account
bhim app.daily_limit: ₹20,000 per day (can be increased to ₹40,000 with higher limits)
bhim app.rewards: Cashback on first transaction, periodic rewards

aadhaar update.what_is: Update or correct information in Aadhaar database
online_update: Login with Aadhaar number and OTP
Pay fee (₹50 for demographic, ₹100 for biometric)
Get Update Request Number (URN) for tracking
offline_update: Visit nearest Aadhaar Seva Kendra or Permanent Enrolment Center
aadhaar update.mobile_number: Essential for online updates, OTP based authentication
aadhaar update.free_updates: First update of name, address, DOB, gender in first 10 years is free
aadhaar update.biometric_update: Recommended every 10 years for children, after age 5 and 15
aadhaar update.important: Keep Aadhaar information current for government benefits

voter id.purpose: Identity proof for voting in elections
voter id.eligibility: Indian citizen, 18 years or above on January 1 of the year
how_to_apply: Online: Visit nvsp.in (National Voters' Services Portal)
Offline: Visit nearest voter help center or electoral registration office
documents_required: Proof of age (Birth certificate, School leaving certificate, Passport)
Proof of residence (Passport, Bank passbook, Ration card, Driving license, Utility bill)
voter id.status_check: Check application status on nvsp.in with reference number
voter id.voter_list: Check name in voter list online (electoralsearch.in)
voter id.duplicate_epic: Apply for duplicate if lost (Form 6 with fee)
voter id.voting_day: Carry EPIC or alternative approved ID for voting

pan card.issued_by: Income Tax Department, Government of India
pan card.eligibility: Any Indian citizen including minors, NRIs, foreign citizens (for transactions in India)
documents_required: Proof of identity (Aadhaar, Voter ID, Passport, Driving license)
Proof of address (Aadhaar, Voter ID, Passport, Bank statement, Utility bill)
Date of birth proof (Birth certificate, School certificate, Passport)
pan card.application_fee: ₹93 (including GST) for Indian communication address, ₹864 for foreign address
pan card.status_check: Check on NSDL/UTI website with acknowledgment number
pan card.e-pan: Instant e-PAN available through Aadhaar based process
pan card.correction: Apply for correction through online portal
pan card.link_aadhaar: Mandatory to link PAN with Aadhaar
pan card.penalty: Not having PAN for eligible transactions attracts penalty

scholarship.national_scholarship_portal: scholarships.gov.in - one stop portal for all government scholarships
application_process: Fill application form with personal/academic details
scholarship.renewal: Many scholarships require annual renewal with marks criteria
scholarship.disbursement: Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) to bank account
scholarship.helpline: Scholarships portal helpline or state helpline numbers
scholarship.important: Apply early, keep documents ready, check eligibility carefully

girl education.campaign: Beti Bachao Beti Padhao (Save Girl Child, Educate Girl Child)
objectives: Ensure survival and protection of girl child
Ensure education and participation of girl child
key_schemes_for_girl_education: Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana - Savings scheme for girl child
Kasturba Gandhi Balika Vidyalaya - Residential schools for girls
National Scheme of Incentives to Girls for Secondary Education
CBSE Merit Scholarship Scheme for Girls

sukanya_samriddhi.interest: Highest interest rate among small savings schemes (currently 8%)
sukanya_samriddhi.opening: At post office or authorized bank branches
sukanya_samriddhi.maturity: 21 years from opening or marriage after 18

government_initiatives: Free education for girls up to higher secondary in government schools
Girls hostel scheme for secondary and higher education
girl education.helpline: Childline 1098 for reporting issues related to girl child
girl education.district_level: Program implemented in 640+ districts across India

pregnancy care.importance: Proper care during pregnancy ensures healthy mother and baby
recommended_visits: First trimester: First visit as soon as pregnancy confirmed
Third trimester: Fortnightly visits (up to 36 weeks), weekly visits (after 36 weeks)
Minimum 4 visits as per government guidelines

janani_suraksha_yojana.amount: ₹1400 (rural), ₹1000 (urban) in low performing states; ₹700 (rural), ₹600 (urban) in high performing states
janani_suraksha_yojana.eligibility: Pregnant women 19 years and above, BPL families

pradhan_mantri_matru_vandana_yojana.eligibility: First live birth, 19 years and above
pradhan_mantri_matru_vandana_yojana.installments: First: Early pregnancy registration, Second: After 6 months pregnancy, Third: After childbirth and vaccination

nutrition_during_pregnancy: Protein rich diet (dal, eggs, milk, nuts)
government_services: Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram (JSSK) - free transport, free treatment
Village Health Nutrition Day at Anganwadi
pregnancy care.postnatal_care: Checkup within 48 hours, 7-14 days, and 6 weeks after delivery

child vaccination.importance: Prevents life threatening diseases, builds immunity

vaccination_schedule.6_weeks: OPV-1, DPT-1, Hepatitis B-1, Rotavirus-1, PCV-1, IPV-1
vaccination_schedule.14_weeks: OPV-3, DPT-3, Hepatitis B-3, Rotavirus-3, PCV-3, IPV-2
vaccination_schedule.16_24_months: DPT booster-1, Measles-Rubella-2, OPV booster, Vitamin A dose

child vaccination.all_free: All vaccines under UIP are completely free at government facilities
child vaccination.vaccination_card: Maintain vaccination card carefully, carry for every visit
child vaccination.side_effects: Mild fever, soreness at injection site - normal, consult doctor if severe
child vaccination.missed_dose: Catch up vaccination available, consult doctor
child vaccination.pulse_polio: Additional polio drops on National Immunization Days
child vaccination.covid_impact: Vaccination services disrupted during COVID, catch up drives ongoing

clean water.importance: Essential for health, prevents waterborne diseases

jal_jeevan_mission.objective: Har Ghar Jal - Tap water connection to every rural household by 2024
jal_jeevan_mission.implementation: Through Gram Panchayats, Village Water & Sanitation Committees
jal_jeevan_mission.funding: Central and state share, community contribution

water_purification_methods: Chlorination (1-2 drops of chlorine solution per liter)
Solar disinfection (clear PET bottles in sun for 6 hours)
Filtration through cloth (for removing Guinea worm)
safe_storage: Wide mouth containers for easy cleaning
Don't dip fingers in drinking water
clean water.hand_pumps_tube_wells: Get water tested for arsenic/fluoride in affected areas
clean water.rainwater_harvesting: Collect and store rainwater for drinking after treatment
clean water.government_testing: Water testing facilities available at public health labs
clean water.community_management: VWSC manages water supply in villages
clean water.water_conservation: Use water wisely, repair leaks, reuse greywater

toilet hygiene.objective: Make India open defecation free (ODF) and maintain cleanliness
importance_of_toilet_use: Protects dignity and safety, especially of women
maintenance_tips: Clean daily with water and cleaning agent
toilet hygiene.swachhagrahi: Community motivator for toilet use and hygiene
toilet hygiene.individual_household_toilet: Financial assistance of ₹12,000 (erstwhile scheme) under SBM
toilet hygiene.community_toilets: In urban slums and public places
toilet hygiene.school_toilets: Separate toilets for boys and girls in all government schools
toilet hygiene.behavior_change: Key focus of Swachh Bharat Mission Phase 2
toilet hygiene.rural_sanitation: ODF Plus villages with solid/liquid waste management
toilet hygiene.urban_sanitation: SBM-U focuses on waste water treatment and fecal sludge management
toilet hygiene.open_defecation_free: Sustaining ODF status through continued use and maintenance

hand washing.importance: Single most effective way to prevent infections

steps: Wet hands with clean running water
Dry with clean cloth or air dry
proper_technique.duration: At least 40-60 seconds (20 seconds of rubbing)

soap_vs_sanitizer.soap_water: Best when hands visibly dirty, removes all germs
soap_vs_sanitizer.sanitizer: When soap not available, at least 60% alcohol content

hand washing.school_programs: Hand washing education in schools under Swachh Bharat
hand washing.anganwadi_activities: Teach children hand washing through play
hand washing.community_approach: Create hand washing stations at community events
hand washing.government_initiative: Swachh Bharat Mission promotes hand washing

first aid.definition: Immediate assistance to injured person before medical help arrives
wound_care: Clean wound with clean water or saline
Change dressing daily or if wet
Seek medical help if deep, bleeding heavily, or signs of infection
bleeding_control: Apply direct pressure on wound with clean cloth
Do not remove object embedded in wound
burns: Cool burn under running water for 10-20 minutes
Do not apply butter, oil, toothpaste
Seek medical help for severe/large burns
fracture: Support with sling for arm injuries
choking: Fist above navel, thrust inward and upward
cpr_basics: If not breathing: Start chest compressions
poisoning: Do not induce vomiting unless instructed
If swallowed poison, give water/milk if instructed
If on skin, rinse with water
heat_stroke: Cool with wet cloth or fan
first aid.training: First aid training available from Red Cross, St John Ambulance, NGOs

indian_snakes.non_venomous: Rat snake, Python, Tree snake, many others

symptoms.cobra_krait: Neurotoxic - Paralysis, drooping eyelids, difficulty breathing, swallowing
symptoms.viper: Hemotoxic - Swelling, bleeding, pain, kidney damage

do_not: DO NOT waste time on traditional remedies
DO NOT run or move excessively
do: Keep bitten part below heart level
Reassure victim - not all bites are venomous

treatment.anti_snake_venom: Only specific treatment, available free at government hospitals
treatment.timing: ASV most effective within 4 hours, still useful later

prevention: Wear shoes/boots when walking at night
Keep surroundings clean, no piles of wood/rubbish
Sleep on cot, not floor in snake prone areas
Use mosquito nets (also protects from snakes)
myths_vs_facts: Myth: Snake bite always fatal - Fact: Only 50% of venomous bites inject venom
Myth: Black snake venomous - Fact: Color not indicator
Myth: Snake charmers can cure - Fact: Only ASV works
snake bite.helpline: Snake bite treatment available at all government hospitals, call 108 for ambulance
snake bite.national_program: National Snakebite Management Protocol under NHM

heat stroke.definition: Severe heat illness when body temperature rises above 40°C (104°F)
risk_factors: Low socioeconomic status (poor housing, no cooling)
symptoms: Hot, dry skin (no sweating in classic heat stroke)
first_aid: Cool rapidly - cold water immersion if possible
Or cover with wet sheets and fan vigorously
Apply ice packs to neck, armpits, groin
prevention: Drink plenty of water (even if not thirsty)
Avoid outdoor work during peak heat (12-3 PM)
Never leave children in parked car
ORS or lemon water for rehydration
heat stroke.heat_cramps: Painful muscle spasms - rest, cool place, ORS
heat stroke.heat_exhaustion: Heavy sweating, weakness, cool clammy skin - treat as above, if worsens seek help
heat stroke.government_advisory: Heat wave warnings from IMD, work hour adjustments in heat prone areas
heat stroke.seasonal_campaigns: Heat action plans in states like Odisha, Gujarat, Telangana

frostbite_first_aid: Warm affected area in warm water (37-39°C)
general_winter_care: Wear multiple layers of warm clothing
Stay dry - wet clothes lose heat rapidly
newborn_care_in_winter: Watch for signs of hypothermia (cold to touch, lethargy)
winter care.cold_wave_warnings: IMD issues cold wave warnings, follow local advisories
winter care.shelters: Night shelters for homeless in cities
winter care.government_schemes: Winter relief distribution in some states
winter care.helpline: 108 for emergencies, 1098 for child in need

first_aid_for_eye_injury: Foreign body: Do not rub, blink to remove, wash with clean water
Chemical splash: Flood with water for 15-20 minutes, seek immediate help
Blow to eye: Cold compress, consult if vision affected
Cut: Cover gently, seek immediate help
daily_eye_care: Wash eyes with clean water daily
Take breaks during screen work (20-20-20 rule: every 20 mins, look 20 feet for 20 seconds)
Eat vitamin A rich foods (carrot, papaya, green leafy veg)
vision_testing: Children: Before school entry, if complaints
spectacles: Store in case when not in use
eye care.national_program: National Programme for Control of Blindness (NPCB)
